title: Climate Change Education Design Through Understanding Climate Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge (Earth science, physics) and general understanding of environmental issues
context.additional_context: Novice-level learners who recognize basic climate change concepts but struggle with systemic understanding and analyzing human activity impacts. Capable of using real-time collaboration tools (Google Jamboard, Padlet) in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Explain the key components of the climate system (atmosphere, hydrosphere, cryosphere, biosphere) and analyze their interactions systematically.
Describe the causes of climate change (natural factors/human activities) and environmental feedback mechanisms using scientific data.
Present practical response strategies based on regional climate change impact scenarios in the form of project reports.

resources: Access to NASA Climate Data Visualization Platform
Subscription to Online Collaborative Whiteboard Tool

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
